         Private Health Insurance Premiums1
Household Contribution to Direct Purchase Insurance2
Medical Portion of Property and Casualty Insurance3

Employee and Self-Employment Payroll Taxes and Voluntary
         Premiums Paid to Medicare Hospital Insurance Trust Fund4

Premiums Paid by Individuals to Medicare Supplementary Medical
         Insurance Trust Fund and the Pre-existing Condition Insurance Plan5
Out-of-Pocket Health Spending
1Excludes government subsidy payments for COBRA coverage for 2009-2011.
2Excludes Affordable Care Act (ACA) health insurance premium tax credits and cost-sharing subsidies beginning in 2014.  Includes payments for the Basic Health Program beginning in 2015.
3Includes the portion of the premium expenditures for property and casualty insurance that are used to pay medical claims for automobile, homeowners multi-peril, or other liability insurance.
4Includes one-half of self-employment contributions to the Medicare Hospital Insurance Trust Fund and Trust Fund revenues from the income taxation of Social Security benefits.

5Includes premiums paid for the Pre-existing Condition Insurance Program (PCIP) for 2010-2014. Excludes Medicaid buy-ins for the Medicare premiums of people eligible for both Medicaid and Medicare (dual eligibles).
NOTES:  Numbers and percents may not add to totals because of rounding. Dollar amounts shown are in current dollars. Percent changes and percent distributions are calculated from unrounded data.
SOURCE:  Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, Office of the Actuary, National Health Statistics Group.
